The estimation of the proportion of human-to-human transmission was based on the assumption that the typical duration of a chain of transmission is equal to the duration of the extra-nosocomial outbreak. As this information was only approximately known, we made the prudent choice that the duration of the extra-nosocomial outbreak was the entire extent of the outbreak in Jos, which was the maximum value from the data available.
